required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Trial of ACZONE (Dapsone) Gel, 7.5% in 9 to 11 Year-Old Patients With Acne Vulgaris
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Phase 4 Safety and Efficacy Trial of ACZONE (Dapsone) Gel, 7.5% in 9 to 11 Year-Old Patients With Acne Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK) and efficacy of ACZONE Gel, 7.5% administered topically once-daily for 12 weeks in 9 to 11 year-olds with acne vulgaris.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AE)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as "any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical trial participant (regardless of the administration of the study drug and its causal relationship to it). An AE could therefore, be any unfavorable and unintended medical occurrence during the participant's participation in the trial, including deterioration of a pre-existing medical condition, an abnormal clinically significant finding in a laboratory assessment, or an abnormal clinically significant finding in the physical examination or vital sign.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in systolic and diastolic blood pressure was evaluated. Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Heart Rate
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in heart rate was evaluated. Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Respiratory Rate
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in respiratory rate was assessed. Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Temperature
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in body temperature was assessed. Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.
Change from baseline in weight was assessed. Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.
Change from baseline in height was assessed. Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Local Dermal Tolerability: Number of Participants With Dryness, Scaling and Erythema as Assessed by Investigator
primary_outcome.description: Local dermal tolerability was evaluated by investigator in terms of presence and absence of dryness, scaling and erythema symptoms and its severity in the areas of body where medication was applied. These symptoms were assessed by using a 4 - point scale of 0 - 3, where 0 = none (no dryness, scaling and erythema) and 3 = severe (marked roughness, heavy scale production and intense redness). The higher score indicated severe symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Local Dermal Tolerability: Number of Participants With Stinging/Burning Symptoms as Assessed by Participants
primary_outcome.description: Local dermal tolerability was evaluated by participants in terms of presence and absence of prickling pain sensation immediately after (within 5 minutes of dosing) and its severity in the areas of body where medication was applied (face). Stinging/burning symptoms were graded on a 4-point scale of 0 - 3 where 0 = none (no stinging/burning), 1 = mild (slight warm, tingling/stinging sensation; not really bothersome), 2 = moderate (definite warm, tingling/stinging sensation that is somewhat bothersome), 3 = severe (hot, tingling/stinging sensation that has caused definite discomfort). The higher score indicated severe symptoms.

other_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration of Dapsone,Dapsone Hydroxylamine and N-acetyl Dapsone at Week 1
other_outcome.description: The mean plasma peak (10 hours postdose) concentrations of dapsone, dapsone hydroxylamine and N-acetyl dapsone were reported.

other_outcome.measure: Trough Plasma Concentration of Dapsone, Dapsone Hydroxylamine and N-acetyl Dapsone at Week 1
other_outcome.description: The trough plasma concentrations of Dapsone, Dapsone hydroxylamine and N-acetyl dapsone were reported.

other_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Inflammatory Lesion Counts
other_outcome.description: Inflammatory lesion counts were the sum of counts of the following lesion types (face only): Papule - a small, red, solid elevation less than (<) 1.0 centimeter (cm) in diameter; Pustule - a small, circumscribed elevation of the skin that contains yellow-white exudate; Nodule - a circumscribed, elevated, solid lesion generally more than 1.0 cm in diameter with palpable depth; Cyst - a smooth, dome-shaped, elevated, freely moveable, skin-colored, round to ovoid lesion greater than 0.7 cm in diameter. Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Inflammatory Lesion Counts
other_outcome.description: Inflammatory lesion counts were the sum of counts of the following lesion types (face only): Papule - a small, red, solid elevation less than 1.0 cm in diameter; Pustule - a small, circumscribed elevation of the skin that contains yellow-white exudate; Nodule - a circumscribed, elevated, solid lesion generally more than 1.0 cm in diameter with palpable depth; Cyst - a smooth, dome-shaped, elevated, freely moveable, skin colored, round to ovoid lesion greater than 0.7 cm in diameter.

other_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Non-inflammatory Lesion Counts
other_outcome.description: Non-inflammatory lesion counts were defined as the sum of counts of the following lesion type (face only): open comedone - a pigmented dilated pilosebaceous orifice (blackhead); closed comedone - a tiny white papule (whitehead). Change from baseline was be calculated by subtracting post-dose value from the baseline value.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Non-inflammatory Lesion Counts
other_outcome.description: Noninflammatory lesion counts were defined as the sum of counts of the following lesion type (face only): open comedone - a pigmented dilated pilosebaceous orifice (blackhead); closed comedone - a tiny white papule (whitehead).

other_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Total Lesion Counts on Face
other_outcome.description: Total lesion counts were defined as the sum of inflammatory lesion counts and noninflammatory lesion counts (face only). Change from baseline was be calculated by subtracting post-dose value from the baseline value.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Lesion Counts on Face
other_outcome.description: Total lesion counts were defined as the sum of inflammatory lesion counts and noninflammatory lesion counts (face only).

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With None (0) or Minimal (1) Score on the Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) for Face
other_outcome.description: Overall severity of acne vulgaris was evaluated by using a 5-point IGA scale: Clear (0) - (no comedones; papules or pustules, residual hyperpigmentation and erythema may be present); Almost clear (1) - (rare comedones; no more than a few small papules and pustules); Mild (2) - (easily recognizable comedones in limited numbers; +/- presence of small papules and pustules); Moderate (3) - (many comedones; +/- easily recognizable small and medium-sized papules; no nodules or cysts; Severe (4) - (widespread and numerous comedones; many small, medium-sized and large papules and pustules; nodules or cysts may or may not be present).

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With None (0) or Minimal (1) Score Plus at Least a 2-Grade Improvement on the Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) for Face
other_outcome.description: Overall severity of acne vulgaris was evaluated by using a 5-point IGA scale: Clear (0) - (no comedones; papules or pustules, residual hyperpigmentation and erythema may be present); Almost clear (1) - (rare comedones; no more than a few small papules and pustules); Mild (2) - (easily recognizable comedones in limited numbers; +/- presence of small papules and pustules); Moderate (3) - (many comedones; +/- easily recognizable small and medium-sized papules; no nodules or cysts; Severe (4) - (widespread and numerous comedones; many small, medium-sized and large papules and pustules; nodules or cysts may or may not be present).

arm_group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5 % gel topically, once-daily to the entire face, neck, upper chest, upper back and shoulders starting from Day 1 under maximal use conditions (2 grams per day) for Day 8 consecutive days, followed by a thin layer to their face and acne-affected areas on the upper chest, upper back, and shoulders for next 11 weeks.
Participants applied ACZONE 7.5% gel topically, once-daily in a thin layer to their face and acne-affected areas on upper chest, upper back, and shoulders for 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Has acne vulgaris on the face, including the nose, with 20 to 100 total lesions (noninflammatory and/or inflammatory).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has uncontrolled systemic disease(s)
- Has severe cystic acne, acne conglobata, acne fulminans, or secondary acne (chloracne, drug-induced acne)
- Has used topical dapsone within 1 month prior to the screening
- Has used oral dapsone within 2 months prior to screening.

facility.name: Center for Clinical and Cosmetic Research
University of Texas Medical School at Houston
Austin Institute for Clinical Research, Inc.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 20 sites in United States (US) between 31 October 2016 (first participant first visit) and 09 March 2018 (last participant last visit).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 105 participants were screened, out of which 100 participants were enrolled into either of the 2 cohorts, Pharmacokinetic (PK) Cohort and Non-PK Cohort.

group.title: PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%
group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5 % gel topically, once-daily to the entire face, neck, upper chest, upper back and shoulders starting from Day 1 under maximal use conditions (2 grams per day) for Day 8 consecutive days, followed by a thin layer to their face and acne-affected areas on the upper chest, upper back, and shoulders for next 11 weeks.

group.title: Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%
group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5% gel topically, once-daily in a thin layer to their face and acne-affected areas on upper chest, upper back, and shoulders for 12 weeks.

baseline.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least one application of study drug.

group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5% gel topically, once-daily in a thin layer to their face and acne-affected areas on upper chest, upper back, and shoulders for 12 weeks.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Peak Plasma Concentration of Dapsone,Dapsone Hydroxylamine and N-acetyl Dapsone at Week 1
outcome.description: The mean plasma peak (10 hours postdose) concentrations of dapsone, dapsone hydroxylamine and N-acetyl dapsone were reported.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who received applications of study drug for at least 8 days under maximal use conditions and had evaluable blood samples for PK analysis.

group.title: PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%

measure.title: Trough Plasma Concentration of Dapsone, Dapsone Hydroxylamine and N-acetyl Dapsone at Week 1
measure.description: The trough plasma concentrations of Dapsone, Dapsone hydroxylamine and N-acetyl dapsone were reported.

outcome.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Inflammatory Lesion Counts
outcome.description: Inflammatory lesion counts were the sum of counts of the following lesion types (face only): Papule - a small, red, solid elevation less than (<) 1.0 centimeter (cm) in diameter; Pustule - a small, circumscribed elevation of the skin that contains yellow-white exudate; Nodule - a circumscribed, elevated, solid lesion generally more than 1.0 cm in diameter with palpable depth; Cyst - a smooth, dome-shaped, elevated, freely moveable, skin-colored, round to ovoid lesion greater than 0.7 cm in diameter. Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment. This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

group.title: ACZONE 7.5%
group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5% gel topically, once-daily to their face for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Inflammatory Lesion Counts

Change from baseline was calculated by subtracting post-dose value from baseline value.

measure.description: Non-inflammatory lesion counts were defined as the sum of counts of the following lesion type (face only): open comedone - a pigmented dilated pilosebaceous orifice (blackhead); closed comedone - a tiny white papule (whitehead). Change from baseline was be calculated by subtracting post-dose value from the baseline value.
measure.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment. This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Non-inflammatory Lesion Counts
outcome.description: Noninflammatory lesion counts were defined as the sum of counts of the following lesion type (face only): open comedone - a pigmented dilated pilosebaceous orifice (blackhead); closed comedone - a tiny white papule (whitehead).
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment. This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

group.title: ACZONE 7.5%
group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5% gel topically, once-daily to their face for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Non-inflammatory Lesion Counts
measure.description: Noninflammatory lesion counts were defined as the sum of counts of the following lesion type (face only): open comedone - a pigmented dilated pilosebaceous orifice (blackhead); closed comedone - a tiny white papule (whitehead).
measure.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment. This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

outcome.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Total Lesion Counts on Face
outcome.description: Total lesion counts were defined as the sum of inflammatory lesion counts and noninflammatory lesion counts (face only). Change from baseline was be calculated by subtracting post-dose value from the baseline value.
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment.This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

group.title: ACZONE 7.5%
group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5% gel topically, once-daily to their face for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Total Lesion Counts on Face
measure.description: Total lesion counts were defined as the sum of inflammatory lesion counts and noninflammatory lesion counts (face only). Change from baseline was be calculated by subtracting post-dose value from the baseline value.
measure.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment.This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Lesion Counts on Face
outcome.description: Total lesion counts were defined as the sum of inflammatory lesion counts and noninflammatory lesion counts (face only).
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment. This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

group.title: ACZONE 7.5%
group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5% gel topically, once-daily to their face for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Lesion Counts on Face
measure.description: Total lesion counts were defined as the sum of inflammatory lesion counts and noninflammatory lesion counts (face only).
measure.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment. This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With None (0) or Minimal (1) Score on the Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) for Face
outcome.description: Overall severity of acne vulgaris was evaluated by using a 5-point IGA scale: Clear (0) - (no comedones; papules or pustules, residual hyperpigmentation and erythema may be present); Almost clear (1) - (rare comedones; no more than a few small papules and pustules); Mild (2) - (easily recognizable comedones in limited numbers; +/- presence of small papules and pustules); Moderate (3) - (many comedones; +/- easily recognizable small and medium-sized papules; no nodules or cysts; Severe (4) - (widespread and numerous comedones; many small, medium-sized and large papules and pustules; nodules or cysts may or may not be present).
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment. This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

measure.description: Overall severity of acne vulgaris was evaluated by using a 5-point IGA scale: Clear (0) - (no comedones; papules or pustules, residual hyperpigmentation and erythema may be present); Almost clear (1) - (rare comedones; no more than a few small papules and pustules); Mild (2) - (easily recognizable comedones in limited numbers; +/- presence of small papules and pustules); Moderate (3) - (many comedones; +/- easily recognizable small and medium-sized papules; no nodules or cysts; Severe (4) - (widespread and numerous comedones; many small, medium-sized and large papules and pustules; nodules or cysts may or may not be present).

outcome.description: Overall severity of acne vulgaris was evaluated by using a 5-point IGA scale: Clear (0) - (no comedones; papules or pustules, residual hyperpigmentation and erythema may be present); Almost clear (1) - (rare comedones; no more than a few small papules and pustules); Mild (2) - (easily recognizable comedones in limited numbers; +/- presence of small papules and pustules); Moderate (3) - (many comedones; +/- easily recognizable small and medium-sized papules; no nodules or cysts; Severe (4) - (widespread and numerous comedones; many small, medium-sized and large papules and pustules; nodules or cysts may or may not be present).
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all enrolled participants who had a baseline assessment and at least one post-baseline assessment.This population was presented as combined data from both cohorts (PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5% and Non-PK Cohort: ACZONE 7.5%).

reported_events.desc: Reported AEs were treatment-emergent AEs that developed/worsened during the âon-treatment periodâ (defined as the period from the time of the first dose of the drug until 12 weeks). The analysis was performed on the safety population.

group.title: PK Cohort
group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5 % gel topically, once-daily to the entire face, neck, upper chest, upper back and shoulders starting from Day 1 under maximal use conditions (2 grams per day) for Day 8 consecutive days, followed by a thin layer to their face and acne-affected areas on the upper chest, upper back, and shoulders for next 11 weeks.

group.title: Non-PK Cohort
group.description: Participants applied ACZONE 7.5% gel topically, once-daily in a thin layer to their face and acne-affected areas on upper chest, upper back, and shoulders for 12 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Authorship and manuscript composition will reflect joint cooperation between multiple investigators and sites and the Sponsorâs personnel. Authorship will be established prior to the writing of the manuscript. As this study involves multiple centers, no individual publications will be allowed prior to completion of the final report of the multicenter study except as agreed with the Sponsor.
